intro: Pedicularis prainiana, commonly known as the Prain's lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments at high altitudes. Its flowers are usually bright red or orange, with a distinctive hooded shape. It is characterized by its lack of leaves on the flowering stems, a feature common in many species of the genus Pedicularis.
